option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"D:/XXE_DEMO/backend":"{\"/src/main/java/com/bookshop/Main.java\":\"This file is the main entry point for a Spring Boot application for a bookshop. It contains the following:\\n\\n`Main`: This is the main class that bootstraps the Spring Boot application.\\n\\n`main(String[] args)`: This is the main method that runs the Spring Boot application.\\n\\nThe file sets up the Spring Boot application and starts the application when the `main()` method is executed.\",\"/src/main/java/com/bookshop/controller/OrderController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot REST controller class for handling order processing in a bookshop application.\\n\\n`OrderController`: A REST controller class that handles order processing for the bookshop application.\\n\\n`processOrder`: A POST mapping method that processes an order by parsing the incoming XML request, extracting the book title, and returning a confirmation message.\\n\\n`processBlindOrder`: A POST mapping method that processes an order in a \\\"blind\\\" manner, where the parser is configured to allow external entity and DTD processing, making it vulnerable to XML External Entity (XXE) attacks.\",\"/src/main/java/com/bookshop/controller/DocumentController.java\":\"This file is a Spring Boot controller class that handles document-related operations for a bookshop application.\\n\\n`DocumentController`: This class is responsible for handling document-related HTTP requests, such as generating PDFs, uploading Excel files, and scanning files using the Apache Tika library.\\n\\n`createPdf`: This function generates a PDF document from an HTML template.\\n\\n`uploadExcel`: This function processes an uploaded Excel file and returns a string response.\\n\\n`tikaScan`: This function scans an uploaded file using the Apache Tika library and returns the extracted content or an error message.\",\"/src/main/java/com/bookshop/service/OfficeService.java\":\"This file contains a single class and one function:\\n\\n`OfficeService`: A service class that provides functionality for processing Excel files.\\n\\n`processExcel`: A function that takes an input stream of an Excel file, creates a workbook from it, and returns the name of the first sheet in the workbook.\\n\\nThe file is responsible for processing Excel files using the Apache POI library and providing a service for this functionality.\",\"/src/main/java/com/bookshop/service/PdfService.java\":\"This file contains a single class and one function:\\n\\n`PdfService`: A service class that generates a PDF document from an HTML string.\\n\\n`generatePdfFromHtml`: A function that takes an HTML string as input, converts it to a PDF document, and returns the PDF as a byte array.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a service for generating PDF documents from HTML content. This can be useful in scenarios where you need to generate PDF reports, invoices, or other documents based on dynamic HTML content.\",\"/src/main/java/com/bookshop/model/BookOrder.java\":\"`BookOrder`: A class that represents a book order, containing information about the book title, quantity, and customer name.\\n\\n`BookOrder()`: The default constructor for the `BookOrder` class.\\n\\n`BookOrder(String bookTitle, int quantity, String customerName)`: The parameterized constructor for the `BookOrder` class, which initializes the book title, quantity, and customer name.\\n\\n`getBookTitle()`: A getter method that returns the book title.\\n\\n`setBookTitle(String bookTitle)`: A setter method that sets the book title.\\n\\n`getQuantity()`: A getter method that returns the quantity.\\n\\n`setQuantity(int quantity)`: A setter method that sets the quantity.\\n\\n`getCustomerName()`: A getter method that returns the customer name.\\n\\n`setCustomerName(String customerName)`: A setter method that sets the customer name.\"}"}
